Response: Pump Track (great for exercise for kids and adults to bike up the hill and get a bit of fun at the end, with potential routes leading from the pump track to connectivity across town.

The community would most benefit from keeping the entire area open to everyone and using the site as a native habitat restoration project and educational site.  Employee a farmer to plant the native plants that benefit the wildlife.

Reintroduce, at a few locations, native silver sage brush.  It already grows on the North hill but is missing from the park.  This will privide hiding cover for resident rabits and other wildlife.  Also, thorugh out the park, the abundance of seasonlong native flowering forbs and leguems should be increase for nitrogen fixation and pollinator habitat.

Blue Heron Dr. drifts shut with snow very easily in winter and so any vegetative improvements along the street edge should be short in height to minimize drifting for the stakeholders living next to the park.
